creator: andrey.smirnoff@mail.ru
text:
Test run in GUI and non-GUI mode is different: success vs. failed:

Test gets run in GUI mode successfully without any errors, so failure email does not get sent; however, in non-GUI mode test would fail and failure email would be sent.

I tried to look for the place where failure email gets sent.

Interestingly, if I disable Test Fragment call (REF: Create EQ records for testing) and add the same samples from this test fragment to the tread group, test would not fail anymore in non-GUI mode.

Investigation required.

Created attachment 31238
In GUI mode test gets successfully executed without sending failure email

In GUI mode test gets successfully executed without sending failure email

creator: andrey.smirnoff@mail.ru
text: Testing project attached (see Bug 56037 - Testing Files.zip).

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
I am not sure to fully understand bug report as Test Plan is complex.

- Regarding notifications
> http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/component_reference.html#Mailer_Visualizer

'Success Limit 	Once this number of successful responses is exceeded after previously reaching the failure limit , a success email is sent. The mailer will thus only send out messages in a sequence of failed-succeeded-failed-succeeded, etc. ' 
So what seems strange to you seems regular according to documentation.

Could you attach JMeter log file for non-gui and gui runs ?
Also if you can create a simple test plan using Debug Sampler and Java Request it would be much easier to analyze.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text: Closing as received no feedback to notes.
